description: This notification is generated when a packet was processed
by MAC address filter, but not every packet will generate one
notification, the same notification only generate once in 30
seconds.

event.Summary: Packet processed by MAC address filter

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfMACfilterTrap HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterInterface s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterDirection s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterACLNumber i 9999 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterAction s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfMACfilterSourceMac s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfMACfilterDestinationMac s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterPacketNumber i 9999 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterReceiveInterface s EXAMPLE

description: The interface which policy apply.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterInterface

description: Inbound or outbound.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterDirection

description: ACL number.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterACLNumber

description: Permit or deny.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterAction

description: Source MAC address.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfMACfilterSourceMac

description: Destination MAC address.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfMACfilterDestinationMac

description: The number of packets permitted or denied by ACL.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterPacketNumber

description: The interface where packet come from.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilterReceiveInterface

description: This notification is generated periodically due to a timer.
The interval of the timer is configured in hpnicfAclIntervalTable.
The notification details the entries about the packet-filter
object, the matched ACL rule and the number of matching packets.

event.Summary: ACL rule match and matching packets ditected in packet filter $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclRuleMatchCount HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2ApplyObjType i 1 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2ApplyObjIndex i 9999 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2ApplyDirection i 1 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2ApplyAclType i 1 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2ApplyAclIndex s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2AclRuleIndex i 9999 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2AclRuleMatchPackets C 9999

description: The object type of packet filter application.
interface: Apply an ACL to the interface to filter packets.
vlan: Apply an ACL to the VLAN to filter packets.
global: Apply an ACL globally to filter packets.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2ApplyObjType

description: The object ID of packet filter application.
Interface: interface index, equal to ifIndex
VLAN: VLAN ID, 1..4094
Global: 0
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2ApplyObjIndex

description: The direction of packet filter application.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2ApplyDirection

description: ACL Type: IPv4, IPv6, default action, MAC, and user.
Take default action as a special ACL group.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2ApplyAclType

description: The index of ACL group used by packet-filter.
If the specified string comprises only digits, it is converted
into a numerical sequence in decimal notation, and regarded as
an ACL group index or a default action. If the string is a
character string beginning with an English letter, it is
regarded as an ACL group name.
Group index range and default action:
Basic type: 2000..2999
Advanced type: 3000..3999
User type: 5000..5999
Default action type: 0
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2ApplyAclIndex

description: The ACL rule index.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2AclRuleIndex

description: The number of packets matched.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2AclRuleMatchPackets

description: This notification is generated immediately when the first
packet of the matched IPv4 flow is captured. Other packets
of the matched flow won't be captured.

event.Summary: First packet of the matched IPv4 flow is captured

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclFirstIPv4PktCaptured HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2ApplyAclIndex s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2AclRuleIndex i 9999 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketIfName s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketDirection i 1 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketBAGG i 0 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketVlanID i 1 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketSrcIP s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketDstIP s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketProtocol i 0 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketDscp i 0 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketIcmpIgmpType i 0 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketIcmpIgmpCode i 0 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketTcpFlags i 1 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketSrcPort i 9999 HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketDstPort i 9999

description: The index of ACL group used by packet-filter.
If the specified string comprises only digits, it is converted
into a numerical sequence in decimal notation, and regarded as
an ACL group index or a default action. If the string is a
character string beginning with an English letter, it is
regarded as an ACL group name.
Group index range and default action:
Basic type: 2000..2999
Advanced type: 3000..3999
User type: 5000..5999
Default action type: 0

variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfPfilter2AclRuleIndex

description: The name of the interface on which the packet is matched.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketIfName

description: The direction the packet is going.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketDirection

description: The bridge-aggregation-interface ID the interface belongs to.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketBAGG

description: The vlan the interface belongs to.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketVlanID

description: Source IP address of IPv4/IPv6 packet.

icmp(1)

udp(17)
igmp(2)
gre(47)
ospf(89)
ipinip(4)
icmp6(58)

ipv6_esp(50)

description: DSCP of IPv4/IPv6 packet.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketDscp

description: The type of ICMP or IGMP packet.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-ACL-MIB::hpnicfAclPacketIcmpIgmpType

description: The code of ICMP or IGMP packet.

tcpsyn(5)

description: This notification is generated immediately when the first
packet of the matched IPv6 flow is captured. Other packets
of the matched flow won't be captured.

event.Summary: First packet of the matched IPv6 flow is captured
